trans-unit.source: Classification
trans-unit.target: Classification

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification

trans-unit.source: What is Classification?
trans-unit.target: What is Classification?

trans-unit.source: Classification algorithms predict the class or category for a single instance of data.
trans-unit.target: Classification algorithms predict the class or category for a single instance of data.

trans-unit.source: For example, email filters use binary classification to determine if an email is spam.
trans-unit.target: For example, email filters use binary classification to determine if an email is spam.

trans-unit.source: There are two forms of classification tasks.
trans-unit.target: There are two forms of classification tasks.

trans-unit.source: The first is binary classification, where the goal is to predict one of two outcomes.
trans-unit.target: The first is binary classification, where the goal is to predict one of two outcomes.

trans-unit.source: The other is multiclass classification, where the goal is to predict one of many outcomes.
trans-unit.target: The other is multiclass classification, where the goal is to predict one of many outcomes.

trans-unit.source: The output of a classification algorithm is called a classifier, which can be used to predict the label of a new (unlabeled) instance.
trans-unit.target: The output of a classification algorithm is called a classifier, which can be used to predict the label of a new (unlabeled) instance.

trans-unit.source: Wondering how to select a classification algorithm?
trans-unit.target: Wondering how to select a classification algorithm?

trans-unit.source: Creates a multiclass classification model using the decision forest algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a multiclass classification model using the decision forest algorithm

trans-unit.target: Creates a multiclass classification model using the decision jungle algorithm

trans-unit.target: Creates a multiclass classification model using a neural network algorithm

trans-unit.source: Creates a multiclass classification model from an ensemble of binary classification models
trans-unit.target: Creates a multiclass classification model from an ensemble of binary classification models

trans-unit.source: Creates an averaged perceptron binary classification model
trans-unit.target: Creates an averaged perceptron binary classification model

trans-unit.source: Creates a Bayes point machine binary classification model
trans-unit.target: Creates a Bayes point machine binary classification model

trans-unit.source: Creates a binary classifier using a boosted decision tree algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classifier using a boosted decision tree algorithm

trans-unit.target: Creates a two-class classification model using the decision forest algorithm

trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classifier using a neural network algorithm

trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classification model using the Support Vector Machine algorithm
